New Records: India recorded the highest winning margin in World Cup history by defeating Sri Lanka by 302 runs.
Mohammed Shami achieved the most expensive five-wicket haul in World Cup history with figures of 10-0-80-5.
Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer scored 82 runs off 56 balls with six sixes.
Jasprit Bumrah took a wicket with the first ball of the innings.
Mohammed Siraj took three wickets in his first two overs.
Mohammed Shami took five wickets, including a double-wicket maiden.
Sri Lanka were bowled out for 55 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka won the toss and chose to bowl first.
Post-Match Reflections: Kusal Mendis expressed disappointment with the performance and acknowledged the good bowling by Madushanka.
Rohit Sharma expressed happiness with the team's qualification for the semi-finals and praised the efforts of the entire squad.
Mohammed Shami was named player of the match and praised the support of his fellow bowlers and the crowd.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the Cricket World Cup 2023.
India secured their place in the World Cup semi-finals with this victory.
The match was held on November 2, 2023.
